co.edu.icesi.nextfruit.modules.model

Class MatchingColor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Color
      • co.edu.icesi.nextfruit.modules.model.ColorDistribution
        • co.edu.icesi.nextfruit.modules.model.MatchingColor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.Paint, java.awt.Transparency, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ColorDistribution>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MatchingColorGroup

    public class MatchingColor
extends ColorDistribution
    This class extends from ColorDistribution and is used to initialize one instance of it using a xyY color. It's main used is to deal with color repetitions statistics using the increaseIfClose() method.
    Author:
    cjortegon
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MatchingColor

        public MatchingColor(double[] xyY,
                     double sensibility,
                     double[][] inverseMatrixM)
        Constructor of a ColorDistribution using a xyY color.
        Parameters:
        xyY - The color to initialize the instance.
        sensibility - The range of colors that will accept the matching to this. Is in the range of (0 -> 1.42) as it is in ColorDistribution.isCloseToXY() method.
        inverseMatrixM - The matrix used to return to RGB color.

    • Method Detail

      • increaseIfClose

        public void increaseIfClose(double[] xyY,
                            int increment)
        Auto-increases the repeat property in increment value if the xyY is close enough to this color.
        Parameters:
        xyY - The color to compare.
        increment - The increment value if the color match.

      • getDescriptor

        public double[] getDescriptor()
        Returns:
        The descriptor of this object is composed of x, y parts of xyY and sensibility.

      • getSensibility

        public double getSensibility()
        Returns:
        The sensibility to match this color
